content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a pig latin transformer called `pig_latinify` that operates on a vector of strings. It iterates over each string and changes it to pig latin. Each iteration should run on a separate thread.

```julia
function pig_latinify(texts::Vector{String})
    nthreads = Threads.nthread()
    chunks = Vector{Vector{String}}(undef, nthreads)
    for i in 1:nthreads
        idx = (i-1) % length(texts) + 1
        chunk_start = idx
        chunk_end = min((idx+length(texts))/nthreads, length(texts))
        chunks[i] = texts[chunk_start:chunk_end]
    end

    results = Vector{String}(undef, length(texts))
    for (i, chunk) in enumerate(chunks)
        Threads.@threads for j in 1:length(chunk)
            if isempty(chunk[j])
                results[i*nthreads+j] = ""
            else
                english_to_pig_latin_map = Dict('a' => 'ay', 'e' => 'y', 'I' => 'ay', 'o' => 'way', 'u' => 'ay')
                vowel_ending = [['a', 'e', 'I', 'o', 'u']; ['A', 'E', 'I', 'O', 'U']]
                english_word_ending = Dict('s' => 'es', 'sh' => 'esh', 'ch' => 'che', 'x' => 'ex', 'z' => 'ez')
                english_to_pig_latin_map["qu"] = "kway"
                words = split(chunk[j])
                for (k, word) in enumerate(words)
                    if isempty(word)
                        results[i*nthreads+k] = ""
                        continue
                    end
                    vowel_index = findfirst(x -> x == 'a' || x == 'e' || x == 'I' || x == 'o' || x == 'u', word)
                    if vowel_index !== nothing
                        if word[1] in vowel_ending
                            results[i*nthreads+k] = "ay" * word[vowel_index[1]:end] * word[1:vowel_index-1]
                        else
                            results[i*nthreads+k] = word[1:vowel_index-1] * "ay" * word[vowel_index:end]
                        end
                    else
                        consonant_ending = findlast(x -> x in english_word_ending, word)
                        if consonant_ending !== nothing
                            results[i*nthreads+k] = word * english_to_pig_latin_map[word[consonant_ending]]
                        else
                            results[i*nthreads+k] = ""
                        end
                    end
                end
            end
        end
    end
    return results
end
```
